explanation: Not correct. MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 requires pointers to point to const-qualified types when that is possible. The code in response_completed_callback operates on uc->filename by unlinking and freeing it — these operations imply the pointed-to object is owned and mutable (freeing a const-qualified pointer would be inappropriate), so filename must be a non-const char * and does not violate 8.13. The members language and category are declared as char * in the struct, but the presented code does not show they are only ever read-only; Agent A’s claim is speculative without examining all uses. In short: there is no demonstrated 8.13 violation in the shown function/definitions; the report is therefore not correct.
